intro: Erigeron adscendens, commonly known as the ascending fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its stems are usually ascending or decumbent, and the leaves are linear to lanceolate, often covered in fine hairs. The showy white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
